entries.name: ENV_PATHS
entries.desc: Paths where env(1) might live.  Some systems are broken and have it in /bin

entries.name: exec_format
entries.desc: Overrides the executable format. This is a sprintf format with a “%s” which will be replaced with the executable name.  It is based off the ruby executable name's difference from “ruby”.

entries.name: install_lock
entries.desc: Certain aspects of the install process are not thread-safe. This lock is used to allow multiple threads to install Gems at the same time.

entries.name: path_warning
entries.desc: True if we've warned about PATH not including Gem.bindir

entries.name: bin_dir
entries.desc: The directory a gem's executables will be installed into

entries.name: build_args
entries.desc: Available through requiring rubygems/installer_test_case

entries.name: env_shebang
entries.desc: Available through requiring rubygems/installer_test_case

entries.name: force
entries.desc: Available through requiring rubygems/installer_test_case

entries.name: format
entries.desc: Available through requiring rubygems/installer_test_case

entries.name: format_executable
entries.desc: Available through requiring rubygems/installer_test_case

entries.name: gem
entries.desc: Filename of the gem being installed.

entries.name: gem_dir
entries.desc: Available through requiring rubygems/installer_test_case

entries.name: gem_home
entries.desc: The gem repository the gem will be installed into

entries.name: ignore_dependencies
entries.desc: Available through requiring rubygems/installer_test_case

entries.name: options
entries.desc: The options passed when the Gem::Installer was instantiated.

entries.name: package
entries.desc: The gem package instance.

entries.name: security_policy
entries.desc: Available through requiring rubygems/installer_test_case

entries.name: wrappers
entries.desc: Available through requiring rubygems/installer_test_case

entries.name: at(path, options = {})
entries.desc: Construct an installer object for the gem file located at path

entries.name: exec_format()
entries.desc: Defaults to use Ruby's program prefix and suffix.

entries.name: for_spec(spec, options = {})
entries.desc: Construct an installer object for an ephemeral gem (one where we don't actually have a .gem file, just a spec)

entries.name: new(package, options={})
entries.desc: Constructs an Installer instance that will install the gem at package which can either be a path or an instance of Gem::Package.  options is a Hash with the following keys:

entries.name: app_script_text(bin_file_name)
entries.desc: Return the text for an application file.

entries.name: build_extensions()
entries.desc: Builds extensions.  Valid types of extensions are extconf.rb files, configure scripts and rakefiles or mkrf_conf files.

entries.name: default_spec_file()
entries.desc: The location of the default spec file for default gems.

entries.name: dir()
entries.desc: Return the target directory where the gem is to be installed. This directory is not guaranteed to be populated.

entries.name: ensure_dependency(spec, dependency)
entries.desc: Ensure that the dependency is satisfied by the current installation of gem. If it is not an exception is raised.

entries.name: ensure_loadable_spec()
entries.desc: Ensures the Gem::Specification written out for this gem is loadable upon installation.

entries.name: extract_bin()
entries.desc: Extracts only the bin/ files from the gem into the gem directory. This is used by default gems to allow a gem-aware stub to function without the full gem installed.

entries.name: extract_files()
entries.desc: Reads the file index and extracts each file into the gem directory.

entries.name: formatted_program_filename(filename)
entries.desc: Prefix and suffix the program filename the same as ruby.

entries.name: gem_dir()
entries.desc: Lazy accessor for the spec's gem directory.

entries.name: generate_bin_script(filename, bindir)
entries.desc: Creates the scripts to run the applications in the gem.

entries.name: generate_bin_symlink(filename, bindir)
entries.desc: Creates the symlinks to run the applications in the gem.  Moves the symlink if the gem being installed has a newer version.

entries.name: generate_windows_script(filename, bindir)
entries.desc: Creates windows .bat files for easy running of commands

entries.name: install()
entries.desc: Installs the gem and returns a loaded Gem::Specification for the installed gem.

entries.name: installation_satisfies_dependency?(dependency)
entries.desc: True if the gems in the system satisfy dependency.

entries.name: installed_specs()
entries.desc: Return an Array of Specifications contained within the #gem_home we'll be installing into.

entries.name: pre_install_checks()
entries.desc: Performs various checks before installing the gem such as the install repository is writable and its directories exist, required Ruby and rubygems versions are met and that dependencies are installed.

entries.name: shebang(bin_file_name)
entries.desc: Generates a #! line for bin_file_name's wrapper copying arguments if necessary.

entries.name: spec()
entries.desc: Lazy accessor for the installer's spec.

entries.name: spec_file()
entries.desc: The location of the spec file that is installed.

entries.name: unpack(directory)
entries.desc: Unpacks the gem into the given directory.

entries.name: windows_stub_script(bindir, bin_file_name)
entries.desc: return the stub script text used to launch the true Ruby script

entries.name: write_build_info_file()
entries.desc: Writes the file containing the arguments for building this gem's extensions.

entries.name: write_cache_file()
entries.desc: Writes the .gem file to the cache directory

entries.name: write_default_spec()
entries.desc: Writes the full .gemspec specification (in Ruby) to the gem home's specifications/default directory.

entries.name: write_spec()
entries.desc: Writes the .gemspec specification (in Ruby) to the gem home's specifications directory.
